channel.title: Debian 13 status and how to upgrade from Debian 12 to 13 via extrepo?
channel.description:
How is the development status for Debian 13? From what I see here, Debian 13 hasn't been added into extrepo data yet. https://salsa.debian.org/extrepo-team/extrepo-data/-/blob/master/repos/debian/kicksecure.yaml?ref_type=heads
I enabled Kicksecure repo from extrepo. How do I upgrade everything from Debian 12 to 13 from the repo contained in extrepo?

item.title: Debian 13 status and how to upgrade from Debian 12 to 13 via extrepo?
item.dc:creator: arraybolt3
item.description:
SteveK1978:

But I think move to Wayland is not a smart move. X has been used for a long time and it is more stable.

X was a more stable platform, and for a limited set of applications it is is preferable to Wayland. The X.org server however has been abandoned upstream, and is for the most part deprecated and bitrotting (this is beginning to show with application support, toolkit support, and driver support, and will get worse over time most likely). Moving to Wayland is not simply a security enhancement move, it is vital for ongoing usability in the future.

SteveK1978:

By the way, I don‚Äôt see any discussion in Kicksecure forum about move from X to Wayland?

It‚Äôs been in planning for a while, but the discussion was mostly on the Whonix forum. See:

Whonix Forum ‚Äì 24 Oct 23

port to Wayland

Development

There have a few Wayland specific forum threads but none generally about a port to Wayland. Make sure Whonix tools support Wayland was done. Currently there is no clear way forward Wayland support‚Ä¶ Except, waiting for Xfce to become Wayland...

Reading time: 1 mins üïë Likes: 17 ‚ù§

Read full topic

item.description:
Oh I see. Thank you.

But I think move to Wayland is not a smart move. X has been used for a long time and it is more stable.

By the way, I don‚Äôt see any discussion in Kicksecure forum about move from X to Wayland?

item.source: Debian 13 status and how to upgrade from Debian 12 to 13 via extrepo?

item.title: Debian 13 status and how to upgrade from Debian 12 to 13 via extrepo?
item.dc:creator: arraybolt3
item.description:
SteveK1978:

Now it is released

Not to my awareness. There is no release announcement for Kicksecure 18 at News - Kicksecure Forums.

SteveK1978:

I can‚Äôt pass file checks with release-upgrade

You aren‚Äôt using full Kicksecure, you‚Äôre using Kicksecure packages on top of Debian, so the release-upgrade script will almost certainly not work for you. It is designed to upgrade a full Kicksecure installation. Regardless though, you still should not be trying to upgrade yet. (We‚Äôre still finding and working out bugs; the Wayland and LXQt transition has taken quite a bit of development work to get right.)

Read full topic

item.title: Debian 13 status and how to upgrade from Debian 12 to 13 via extrepo?
item.dc:creator: arraybolt3
item.description:
It still is probably a good idea to wait for Kicksecure 18 to be released, since those package‚Äôs contents may change substantially and there may be upgrade issues with them if you try to upgrade now.

Read full topic
item.source: Debian 13 status and how to upgrade from Debian 12 to 13 via extrepo?

item.title: Debian 13 status and how to upgrade from Debian 12 to 13 via extrepo?
item.dc:creator: SteveK1978
item.description:
I didn‚Äôt install full Kicksecure because there are too many things that I don‚Äôt need, such as GUI and Tor.

I have only installed certain packages from Kicksecure.

I did apt install -y security-misc usability-misc tirdad* sandbox-app-launcher kicksecure-base-files dist-base-files apparmor-profiles-kicksecure apparmor-utils on a Debian 12 fresh installation.

Read full topic
item.source: Debian 13 status and how to upgrade from Debian 12 to 13 via extrepo?

item.title: Debian 13 status and how to upgrade from Debian 12 to 13 via extrepo?
item.dc:creator: arraybolt3
item.description:
Kicksecure 17 is based on Debian 12 (Bookworm) and is not compatible with Debian 13 (Trixie). Kicksecure 18 will be based on Debian 13.

Kicksecure 18 is still in (very active) development, it isn‚Äôt suitable for daily use or beta testing yet (though it may be pretty close to beta-testable). When it is available, you will be able to upgrade an existing Kicksecure 17 installation using a release-upgrade script, and ISOs and VM images will be available for clean installation. Until it is released however, do not attempt to upgrade your system to Debian 13, you will break your system.

Read full topic
